description: Was fine until a few days gao when it changed itself automagically to a language so bizarre I could never have found the 'English' option. Uninstalled, reinstalled this version, now it will neither connect with my mounted partition where I keep my files nor play the playlists I created on previous installation on the local drive (probably for the same reason). Why would anyone bother with such a buggy application? I'm done giving it chances- when it first came out years ago I had the same issues with language changing suddenly! Their github issues "help" tells you to change in preferences but if the display language is UNKNOWN, how on earth does that help?!?

description: So disappointing

I've used this on Windows10 and loved it. Works great with Ubuntu 20. Nice features. My only big complaint is the way that it takes my music directory and screws it up when listing the songs in the Clementine library. Why can't these apps just read a users music directory and folders and present it the way it is.
would not even start with ubuntu 20.04
So many features, such a robust, powerful music library organisor and player. Exactly this is what I've been looking for!! Would recommend wholeheartedly.

Is far the best available audio player for Ubuntu. It has notifications, equalizer, visualizations, etc.
Nevertheless the Interface is still old looking to me, shuffle and repeat commands needs several clicks and are almost invincible. 
It would be great a very small window able to be always on top. 
I use it cause is the best option for ubuntu, but I still dream with a Winamp like program for Ubuntu, with a dynamic library and so cool and intuitive interface!
works fine. but but when volume increased too noisy.

summary: Can't access my music files!! Useless for me

description: Appears to be still using GTK2 and is unusable on a 4K screen as it ignores scaling.
Used for years. Easy to use, and clear equalising

Unlike every other audio player I tried rom Ubuntu Software, this one plays my music, from my external hard drive or wherever else I put it. You do have to know about Linux filesystems to get to your external media, and you do have to set the permissions properly. But it's fast and the audio is good quality and it doesn't try to think for you. If you've been having problems with the other players (like Tauon) this one may work for you.

A lot of the bad reviews are because it won't play except from the home directory. Don't ignore the "permissions" button, that is where you can set it to read from external USB, etc. I have no idea why they restricted access by default, but it's easy to fix it. I'm enjoying Clementine music as I type.
Nice, have a bunch of add-ons
summary: Perfect, works out of a box

Great interface, almost perfect functionality. Stable.
Fantastic music player that is great for handling large music collections

description: WOW! This is bad, free, sure so I shouldn't complain but I will since there's alternatives. It just reset my prefrences sometimes, why? Also the prefrences are bad (kinda like my spelling, classic), why is it so restricted to album/artist left, song list right? I have a good music player for you Windows Media Player, wish it was here, not even making a joke, I WANT IT! But there is a music player that's even better if you give it time to seatle in, MUSIC BEE! (only for windows) Wait if it's only for Windows why did i include it? Good question. Anyway, nice weather we're having. It's cold, dark, bad ui and extreme loading times. Oh wait that's Clementine, nooo... wait... that wouldn't work either. It's not cold or dark... Ehhhhh, tip if you're looking for image sorting software, the best I found was DigiKam. Not related to this but I don't want to talk about "Orange". Gottem. Also this is not a modern music player in any way. It looks like it's from 2001, how? Sooo, conclusion... bad software, great affort. It's free. No one had to create clementine but they did. Why would you do that? Waste of time, instead make a awesome music player by gathering more people. I don't know why I wrote this, I just wasted 2 minutes of your life but saved you (maybe) from 30 minutes trying to get this to work and then it just resets. SEVERAL TIMES DID IT RESET! WHHYYYY!? And the icon also didn't work. Also it crashed alot. Also it takes like 1 minute for it to start. Also, cry about it. Maybe you thought it was a good review since it was long, no. Again, cry about it. Or don't, I rather you don't. I actually want people to be happy. I know, mad. I saw this funny youtube video a few days ago. Look up DankPods on youtube and find a Cashies video, I thought it was very funny. He talkes about mostly MP3 players but not always. He's a music guy at least. If you enjoyed it, leave a like from me. I don't have a google account, if you didn't then I hope you don't feel this was too much wasted time. Life is a big clown car and you are one of the clowns, and me, and everyone. Have a good day, don't delete this review admins. That'd be boring, kinda like the review. Two boring don't make a funny. Didn't I just end this review, oh my it's long. Well it took me 30 minutes to write this, I must be very bored. Have a good day for real this time. (or night)

summary: I like it when it works

description: This is a good app - it is intuitive, plays well and is easy to use. But recently the nice "slice of clementine" icon has disappeared from the launcher and been replaced by an ugly generic cog. I think a recent update has caused this. Could the problem please be fixed?
summary: Good app. But what happened to the slice icon?

description:
I boot from an SSD but keep my music on an internal SATA hard disk. Despite changinf all the permissions this software was unable to open the SATA disk. It only appears to work for files on the boot disk, which seems daft!

Obvioulsy it's free so it didn't cost me anything. I guess that also means it isn't regularly maintained or upgraded.
I use Ubuntu Studio. Was always shutting down by itself. I also don't like the design. I will try something else. And it was preloaded with too many things I never use anyways.

Reasonably functional is about the best I can say about this app. Smart playlists work reasonably well except... whyy aren't all tags available? I tried to create a smart playlist for the AIFF files in my library so I can convert them to MP3. Nope. OK. I tried to manually create a playlist containing those songs which I can access OK... except after I close it. I haven't the slightest idea how to play it or access the songs once it goes into the "Playlist" section of thesidebar. It's just a folder with songs. Double click the playlist does nothing. Double click a song in it does nothing. Shuffle does nothing. Play button does nothing. What's the point? What the heck is a playlist even for if you can't play it? If they ever start developing this app again, they need to ditch the wonky playlist-focused design and just let people play music.
This app is an excellent music player but the iPod integration didn't work. I don't know if it's in "Devices" or not. If it does work, please tell me where this is.

Does everything it says on the tin and does it better than most. Easy to set up and plenty of capacity for large playlists. Had it before on previous distro's and will be staying with it again this time,
summary: Better than most if not all I've used before

description: the tagline is "a modern music player," but its aesthetic and GUI is from 2009. It even uses an iPod as the symbol for "Devices." at least it starts and is functional.

It started very late at first install. Can't see my folders under /media because it doesn't have permissions. I went straight to deleting but saw the permissions button next to delete, I updated and gave all permissions, now it won't start at all. Very bad experience and waste of time for me at its current state.
Why is this even available on Ubuntu software?
The app is great but not all the time, sometimes it just shut down without any reason, refuse to work at all, or lower the volume for some tracks suddenly.
I tried couple of music players and finally settled on Clementine. It does exactly what I want - scan a dir for music and powerful playlists.

I'm going through my CD collection and putting it all on here and I'm very happy with the results.
